intro: Sarcanthus hirtus, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and also bear a similar hairy texture. Sarcanthus hirtus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
